CODIF_DATA.TD_DOCUMENT_TYPE: Periodic indicative notice with call for competition
CODIF_DATA.MA_MAIN_ACTIVITIES: Production, transport and distribution of gas and heat
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 08F04

TI_TEXT.P: Equipo de telemetría y equipo terminal
Matériel de télémétrie et équipement terminal

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.ADDRESS: Wales and West House, Spooner Close, Celtic Springs, Coedkernew

TITLE.P: Remote Gas Pressure Monitoring and Control Hardware, Software and Cloud Based Interface Solution

SHORT_DESCR.P: Wales and West Utilities Ltd (WWU), is a regulated gas distribution business with around 35 000 km of gas distribution pipelines located within Wales and the South West of England. The intention of this PIN is to inform WWU of the market options available with regard to the supply or development and subsequent supply of pressure monitoring and controlling equipment for gas mains pressures and the supporting software to view and control the pressures remotely in real time. Project aim is to identify an environmentally acceptable solution to assist in the reduction of shrinkage gas whilst supporting network pressure stabilisation. WWU is interested in identifying potential providers/developers of such equipment utilising innovative technology to future proof our diverse network infrastructure remote monitoring requirements following the impending retirement of existing 3G/PSTN and ultimately 2G communications technologies. Project may be eligible for NIA funding. See Section VI.

LOT_COMBINING_CONTRACT_RIGHT.P: Lot 1 and lot 2 may be awarded under the same contract.

TITLE.P: Lot 1: Provision of Gas Pressure Monitoring Equipment and Associated Software for Remote Communication

MAIN_SITE.P: Wales and the South West of England.

SHORT_DESCR.P: WWU is looking for supplier(s) to develop (if required) and supply pressure monitoring and controlling equipment for gas mains pressures and the supporting software to view the pressures remotely in real time with the requirement to also control the pressures. The provision should offer an alternative/innovative solution to future proof our diverse network infrastructure remote monitoring requirements following the impending retirement of existing 3G/PSTN and ultimately 2G communications technologies. These technologies should not be offered as a solution. WWU have a rugged and diverse geographical network infrastructure which extends to remote locations where standard telecommunications signals may be compromised. Not all locations will have mains power therefore the offering must provide an environmentally friendly power solution, whilst offering reliability from failure to report. Logging and reporting equipment could be located within (but not limited to) district governors, acceptable street furniture, low level metal kiosks and customer meter boxes/kiosks. The equipment needs to transmit logging/alert information in real-time, be intrinsically safe and operate on low pressure and medium pressure gas networks (0,75 mbar to 2 Bar). Consumables and support/maintenance spares are also required. WWU will consider the whole product life cycle including consumable items and end of life disposal. The offered solution should compliment and integrate with existing systems/hardware that is already in use within our network. It is anticipated future logger volumes with be circa 5 000 units over a period of time (not single purchase).

TITLE.P: Lot 2: Remote Gas Monitoring and Pressure Management Cloud based Software Solution and Associated Support

MAIN_SITE.P: Wales and South West of England.

SHORT_DESCR.P: WWU require a cloud based software solution which can real time report, alert, control and manage the gas pressure data logging equipment to be provided under lot 1.

The pressure monitoring data at the extremities of a low pressure network will be used to control the governor pressures at an optimal level. This is to ensure security of supply whilst keeping the average system pressure to a minimum. The solutions must be intrinsically safe.

The WWU requirement is for the integration between remote monitoring devices and cloud software to be based upon open standards and be capable of fully secure end to end communication without the need for any proprietary protocols. The cloud software will receive remote data, process and analyse at scale multiple data sources to ascertain the optimal forecast for the next period. This should be communicated back to the remote devices in near real time cycle.
Solutions offered may need to be capable of an API link into our SCADA systems. Details will be required in the tender.
Offering should provide clear one off and all on-going costs (license/airtime/support, etc.)

SUITABILITY.P: If applicable, details will be provided within the tender documentation.

RULES_CRITERIA.P: If applicable, details will be provided within the tender documentation.
In the event that applicants form a joint venture, partnership or other form of consortia, joint and several liability of each participant will be required by the contracting entity.

INFO_ADD.P: The project will be funded using the Network Innovation Allowance and that funding is available until March 2021. Interested parties are encouraged to consider their individual contributions to the project. We recognise that projects financed by NIA may create IPR and we will require successful partners to enter into contractual arrangements to ensure the dissemination of knowledge.

Applicants wishing to participate in this sourcing activity must express an interest to participate in any future sourcing activity which may follow this expression of interest request by e-mailing wwuprocurement@wwutilities.co.uk before the closure date and time of this notice provided in section IV.2.2).
Please include the following information in your e-mail:
2) Main contact details (name, job title, e-mail address and telephone number).

Please note any future sourcing activity as a result of this PIN will be run via our procurement portal BravoSolution, which requires suppliers to be registered and subsequently invited to participate. Failure to register will result in the supplier not being able to participate in the sourcing event.
Pre-qualification/tender documents will be accessed via an electronic sourcing portal and an e-mail will be sent in reply to your Expression of Interest e-mail containing the link to the system.
